qas.question: Who was the first to develop literature?
What syles did writers in Arabic literature experiment with first?
What was the first modern Egyptian novel?
When was Munammad Huayn Haykal's first modern novel published?

context: Egyptian literature traces its beginnings to ancient Egypt and is some of the earliest known literature. Indeed, the <a0_0>Egyptians<a0_0/> were the first culture to develop literature as we know it today, that is, the book. It is an important cultural element in the life of Egypt. Egyptian novelists and poets were among the first to experiment with <a1_0>modern styles<a1_0/> of Arabic literature, and the forms they developed have been widely imitated throughout the Middle East. The first modern Egyptian novel <a2_0>Zaynab<a2_0/> by Muhammad Husayn Haykal was published in <a3_0>1913<a3_0/> in the Egyptian vernacular. Egyptian novelist Naguib Mahfouz was the first Arabic-language writer to win the Nobel Prize in Literature. Egyptian women writers include Nawal El Saadawi, well known for her feminist activism, and Alifa Rifaat who also writes about women and tradition.
